alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Johnston; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Johnston, north central Bryan, southern Coal, southeastern Pontotoc and Atoka Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Coalgate to near Wapanucka. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Atoka, Coalgate, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Lehigh, Tupelo, Tushka, Caney, Bromide, Clarita, Lane, Olney, Coleman, Phillips, Atoka Reservoir, Jesse, Bentley, McGee Creek Lake, Redden, and Boggy Depot Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
